title: The Secret Lives of Backyard Bugs: Discover Amazing Butterflies, Moths, Spiders, Dragonflies, and Other Insects!
features: With this book in hand, readers of any age will discover -- just outside their own doors, no matter where they live--a world they never knew existed.

combined with expert information create an up-close-and-personal tour of the hidden lives of spiders, beetles, butterflies, moths, crickets, dragonflies, damselflies, grasshoppers, aphids, and many other backyard residents. You won't believe your eyes! Each creature is in its natural setting, and many are shown progressing through all of the various stages of their life cycles. This is a one-of-a-kind look at some of life's most fascinating mysteries -- surprising, captivating, and perfect for nature lovers of all ages."The Secret Lives of Backyard Bugs" has earned two national awards --(1) NOBA -
for "Product of Excellence for the Family".
description: The pages are filled with great color photos arranged in a magazine-like format. The whole book seems like
it could be the bug edition of Ranger Rick

. The back of the book has comparison charts to help identify eggs, larvae, pupae, and adults. It would make a great home reference book for any kid interested in bugs.  - Kaylee from Goodreads In awe filled photography we are able to see complete life cycles of insects and spiders from eggs to larvae, pupa to adult. This is by far one of the most interesting bug books I have ever read. It also includes a top host and nectar plant guide, comparison guides for each stage of the life cycle, and briefly touches on plant and soil life. Detailed descriptions and photographs make this book interesting even for those who aren't overly fond of insects. -- Melanie Schemanski (melanieski.blogspot.com)"For all aspiring entomologists, or even just plain nature lovers, this book should be part of your library." --Aron Row (citybookreview.com)The entire book is filled with amazing photographs that will delight readers of all ages.  Each of the sections about the insects has wonderful basic information with pictures of the different stages of the insect. The brother-sister author team has brought the mysterious world of these little critters to life. And this book is a great way to start to learn about insects whether you are 5 or 55. This book is an excellent book for children, grandchildren, a favorite teacher or a favorite gardener.-- Donna Donabella (GardensEyeView.com)

If we can just encourage people to care about nature on a personal level it will change their lives forever.  And we know from our own experiences that families who share their outdoor activities together form closer bonds to each other.  Our childhood love for butterflies fueled our quest to become naturalists and has led us on the adventure of a lifetime as we grew into nature photographers, authors and public speakers.

Naturalists Judy Burris and Wayne Richards, a sister-brother author team, have been intrigued with butterflies since they were children. They have spent many years observing, raising, and photographing these miraculous creatures along with many other insects and animals. Their
) has earned two national awards from
-- a Teacher's Choice Award for "Children's Books" and a "Product of Excellence for the Family." Their

author: {'avatar': 'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/S/amzn-author-media-prod/e46d2349h7l19pkinl2cpchkqp._SY600_.jpg', 'name': 'Wayne Richards', 'about': ["We are Judy Burris and Wayne Richards (and Wayne's wife Christina), a sister-brother author and photographer team. We have been intrigued with butterflies since we were children. We were raised to have a strong respect for the natural world and always enjoyed spending time on hiking trails looking for animals and trying to identify the trees, wildflowers and insects that we saw.", 'As adults, this childhood interest in animal and plant life has translated into a nearly full-time devotion to gardening specifically to support butterflies in every stage of their development, (egg - caterpillar - chrysalis - butterfly). We have spent many years observing, hand-raising, and photographing these miraculous creatures in our own backyard butterfly gardens. We live in northern Kentucky just across the Ohio River from Cincinnati. We enjoy teaching others about flower gardening, nature photography and butterfly life cycles. We encourage everyone to give more serious thought to natural habitat conservation and responsible, poison-free management of their own backyards to support native flora and fauna for future generations to enjoy.', 'Our first book, "The Life Cycles of Butterflies" (2006) won two Teacher\'s Choice Awards - one for \'Children\'s Books\' and one for \'Product of Excellence for the Family\'. We have been documenting the life cycles of other insects including lightning bugs, giant silk moths, lady bugs, lace wings, spiders, praying mantis, and many others so we decided to write a book about those.', 'Our second book, "The Secret Lives of Backyard Bugs" (2011) won the National Outdoor Book Award (NOBA) and also the Teacher\'s Choice Award for \'Product of Excellence for the Family\'. So then we decided to write a book that includes mushrooms, spring flowers, birds, animals and lots of fun projects.', 'Our third book, "Nature\'s Notes" (2012) won Creative Child Magazine\'s "PREFERRED CHOICE AWARD" in the Kids Educational Books category, as well as the Mom\'s Choice Awards GOLD seal for best in family-friendly products, and also FIRST PLACE for the Royal Dragonfly Book Award in the category of photography.', 'We are also public speakers and offer a wide range of subjects and presentations for workshops and events including:', 'Master Gardeners', 'Flower and Garden Shows', 'Libraries', 'Garden or Camera Clubs', 'Nature Preserves and Parks', 'Conservatories', 'Wildlife Conferences', 'Schools and Universities', 'Our presentations can include the following for any age group:', 'Power point slide show - book signing and sales - live insects (seasonal) - how to attract butterflies and hummingbirds to your pesticide-free garden - educational display setups - insect specimens for show and tell - question and answer session - tips on how to photograph insects in your own garden and in the wild - habitat conservation and wildlife interaction in healthy habitats - the life cycle stages of butterflies and other insects - identification of host and nectar plants and why they are so important - instructions on how to hand raise your own butterflies and insects for fun and education - the importance of focusing on native plantings to preserve', 'and support our native insect populations.', 'We customize our presentations for your event.', 'Check out our website at ButterflyNature.com']}
